eight pediatric endocrinologists, writing in journal Pediatrics, say it is premature to conclude that normal age of puberty is occurring earlier; warn that doctors might miss serious medical problems like tumors or genetic disorders that can cause early puberty, if they assume that girls who start developing at 6 or 7 are normal;
